question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable for demonstration purposes. Change the data to 'Intelligent Manufacturing Base Command Center' with table headers as follows: Order Number, Work Order, Work Order Description, Project Quantity, Planned Progress, Actual Progress, Planned Start Time, Planned Completion Time, Actual Start Time, Current Process, Status, Abnormal Status. Please randomly generate data according to these headers and return the complete code.

checklist.title: Is the intelligent manufacturing command center data structure correctly implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements all required table headers (Order Number, Work Order, Work Order Description, Project Quantity, Planned Progress, Actual Progress, Planned Start Time, Planned Completion Time, Actual Start Time, Current Process, Status, Abnormal Status) with appropriate data types and logical relationships. Score 0 if core data fields are missing, 5 if basic structure exists but lacks proper validation, and 10 if all fields are properly structured with realistic manufacturing data patterns.

checklist.title: Is the random data generation logic realistic and comprehensive?
checklist.description: Check whether the randomly generated data follows manufacturing industry standards and logical consistency (e.g., actual start time should not precede planned start time, progress values should be between 0-100%, status should correlate with progress). Deduct 5 points if data lacks manufacturing context realism, 3 points if temporal logic is inconsistent. Full score requires at least 20+ realistic data entries with proper manufacturing workflow simulation.

checklist.title: Is the command center dashboard visualization effectively implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the interface resembles a professional manufacturing command center with appropriate data presentation methods (tables, charts, status indicators). Should include real-time status visualization and progress tracking elements. Deduct 5 points if only basic table display is implemented, 3 points if missing manufacturing-specific visual elements like progress bars or status indicators. Full score requires comprehensive dashboard layout.

checklist.title: Are manufacturing-specific features and interactions properly integrated?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes manufacturing command center specific functionalities such as filtering by status, sorting by priority, progress monitoring, and abnormal status alerts. Should provide search/filter capabilities for work orders and real-time status updates. Deduct 5 points if basic manufacturing workflow features are missing, 3 points if interaction capabilities are limited. Give 10 points if comprehensive manufacturing management features are implemented.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as invalid date ranges, null data entries, progress value overflows, status inconsistencies, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the manufacturing command center experience (e.g., 1. Real-time production efficiency analytics 2. Predictive delay warnings 3. Interactive Gantt chart visualization 4. Export functionality for production reports). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple sorting mechanisms coexisting) 2. Function modules unrelated to manufacturing command center (e.g., built-in games or entertainment features) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations on data tables). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core manufacturing data display functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating data generation/presentation/interaction layers), code organization, and maintainability. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the code structure is not scalable for additional manufacturing data types. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional command center design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows industrial command center aesthetics: 1) Professional color scheme suitable for manufacturing environment (dark themes preferred) 2) Clear data hierarchy and readable typography (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times) 3) Appropriate use of status colors (red for abnormal, green for normal, yellow for warning). Deduct 3 points for each unclear visual element, 5 points for unprofessional color combinations, and 5 points for poor data readability. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to command center operation requirements: 1) Data loading and filtering response time ≤ 200ms 2) Smooth table sorting and pagination transitions 3) Clear visual feedback for user interactions 4) Appropriate hover and selection states. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for laggy data operations, and 5 points for unclear interactive elements. The full score is 10 points.
